posts.name: Anonymous Pony
posts.cooked:
Situation:

  • Users A and B don‚Äôt have each other in their contacts
  • A messages B, B accepts the message request, thus B‚Äôs profile key is shared with A
  • B blocks, then immediately unblocks A again
  • A sends a message to B or tries to call B

Expected outcome:

  • B will see another message request (because the documentation states that B‚Äôs profile key is rotated when they block someone)

Actual outcome:

  • B will receive messages/calls from A without a second message request

Why?

PS: In case it matters, let‚Äôs assume that A uses Android and B uses iOS.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: The message request only happens when a contact is unknown. Blocking just hides a contact, it doesn‚Äôt remove it from the database. But an actual hide/remove option is in development which will force the message request again.

posts.name: Anonymous Pony
posts.cooked:
Is this also the reason why left/deleted groups will still show up as potential recipients when you create a new conversation?

I have a large number of zombie groups and I can‚Äôt even change their name. I believe that only blocking the groups will hide them. (EDIT: Seems this only affects desktop apps?)

EDIT: the current documentation is confusing then. It should explain that there is a difference between the phone contacts (ephemeral) and signal contacts (permanent).

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
Avitus:

is in development

Can you cite or reference the source please?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: You can enable the feature flag in app and discover this behavior.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Building your own version of Signal and setting the flag to true.

Avitus:

But an actual hide/remove option is in development which will force the message request again.

does not seem to be implemented yet. I have just tested it.
New contact with username search from device A to device B.
On device B the message request was shown.
Then blocking the contact from message request screen and then deleting the chat also from message request screen.
Then sending more messages from device A to device B when contact from device A was blocked.
On device B then unblocking the block contact.
Send from device A one message to B. No message request on device B.
And on device A the profile name and avatar photo are shown of device B.

For device B device A shouldn‚Äôt be a Signal Connection then

  • starting a chat
  • accepting a message request
  • having them in your system contacts

isn‚Äôt true.

B hasn‚Äôt started the chat, hasn‚Äôt accepted the message request and A isn‚Äôt in the system contacts of B.

Signal.DE:

does not seem to be implemented yet. I have just tested it

It does not sound like you tested the feature @Avitus was referring to. The feature is the ‚ÄúRemove‚Äù option you see when long pressing a contact in the ‚ÄúNew Message‚Äù screen.

Signal.DE:

On device B then unblocking the block contact.
Send from device A one message to B. No message request on device B.

Does this mean you received the messages? I think the client behaves as if you have accepted the message request (and thus shared your profile) when you unblock a previously blocked contact, even if you had not accepted+shared before. I‚Äôm not sure whether that is intentional, but it is problematic since it‚Äôs not clear to the user that this is what will happen.

Ok, only tested the blocking of the contact and deleting of the chat from message request screen. Seems i was to fast by accepting the ‚ÄúDelete‚Äù in the megaphone.
Was only deleting the chat. Not deleting the blocked contact.

Here some screenshots after removing the contact from the contact list.
The message request in this case is implemented. The message request on first contact looks similar.

signal-2024-03-28-192943_002540√ó960 77 KB
signal-2024-03-28-192943_003540√ó960 73.8 KB
signal-2024-03-28-192943_004540√ó960 81 KB
signal-2024-03-28-192943_005540√ó960 75.3 KB

Herohtar:

Does this mean you received the messages?

The messages while the contact was blocked weren‚Äôt received. (Technically seen: Not sure if received and dropped or or not received at all. I think the first case, then the server don‚Äôt know blocked contacts?)
The message after unblocking was received and the profile was directly shared. Maybe be sending the delivery receipt, which has the keys to decrypt the profile.

Herohtar:

it‚Äôs not clear to the user that this is what will happen.

Only this small warning when unblocking a block contact.

signal-2024-03-28-192943_006540√ó960 65.1 KB

From the ‚Äúblocked users‚Äù screen it isn‚Äôt possible to delete the contact, only unblocking.
A blocked contact is also not shown in the contact list, no deletion here possible.
To delete a blocked contact unblocking is necessary.
Improvements are clearly possible here.

When you unblock in android, you share profile key automatically. No message request bc they have your profile key.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked: Deleting also does not truly delete them from Signal, it just hides them.So if you unblock someone to delete them you gain nothing by doing that

Meteor0id:

Deleting also does not truly delete them from Signal, it just hides them

It also rotates your profile key, so your profile will no longer be shared with them, and their state is reset so that any future messages from them will result in a message request.

Meteor0id:

if you unblock someone to delete them you gain nothing by doing that

That depends on what your goal is. If you want to remove every single trace of them from Signal‚Äôs database, it won‚Äôt do that, but it will remove them from your block list and contact list so you don‚Äôt see any entry from them. And it allows them to message you again, but with a message request, in case you‚Äôve decided you want to give them a second chance, but don‚Äôt fully trust that they will behave.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: I believe this was also a step 1 right? For now it servers well for contact management. But hopefully they‚Äôll start progressively removing the IDs from the seperate places they exist.

Herohtar:

I think the client behaves as if you have accepted the message request (and thus shared your profile) when you unblock a previously blocked contact,

Tested with a linked Desktop. Blocked a contact from primary device (Android) and unblocked from SignalDesktop. SignalAndroid shows
‚ÄúYou accepted the message request‚Äù (synced message from Desktop)

On desktop:
‚ÄúYou blocked the person‚Äù
‚ÄúYou accepted the message request‚Äù
(The second entry was from blocking and unblocking a second time, but both from Android)

Bildschirmfoto_2024-03-30_18-15-29487√ó305 36.8 KB

Desktop has more info-logs in the chats than Android. On Android ‚ÄúYou blocked the person‚Äù and ‚ÄúYou accepted the message request‚Äù are missing in total when blocking and unblocking is done on Android.

Meteor0id:

Deleting also does not truly delete them from Signal, it just hides them.

Hopefully in a future version the deletion will be a real deletion.

Herohtar:

it won‚Äôt do that, but it will remove them from your block list and contact list so you don‚Äôt see any entry from them. And it allows them to message you again, but with a message request, in case you‚Äôve decided you want to give them a second chance, but don‚Äôt fully trust that they will behave.

Yes, delete/remove the users from the block list, but without direct profile sharing. Unblocking shouldn‚Äôt include a message request accepting.

@Herohtar

Can this thread maybe changed to a feature request?

Unblocking someone shouldn‚Äôt automatically enable a profile sharing.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It sucks. It should act like hiding. For now we have to hide the contact, then block it, then unblocking should NOT initiate profile sharing.

posts.name: Anonymous Pony
posts.cooked: Just checking in here after two years. Feels like contact blocking and deletion is still somewhat of a mess, and also inconsistent between the Android and Mac clients. Not a very helpful comment, I know. Happy to elaborate further if others feel like the issues have been resolved.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: What is being inconsistent for you? I‚Äôm seeing the option on both Android, iOS and Desktop at the moment.
